channel.title: Data Breach & Ransomware Aggregator
channel.description: Real-time data breach notifications from state registries, federal sources, and ransomware trackers

item.title: Dark Patterns Undermine Security, One Click at a Time
item.description:
People trust organizations to do the right thing, but some websites and apps have user interfaces that ultimately lead to inadequate security.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 8-Minute Access: AI Accelerates Breach of AWS Environment
item.description:
The AI-assisted attack, which started with exposed credentials from public S3 buckets, rapidly achieved administrative privilges.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: GlassWorm Malware Returns to Shatter Developer Ecosystems
item.description:
The self-replicating malware has poisoned a fresh set of Open VSX software components, leaving potential downstream victims with infostealer infections.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Russian Hackers Weaponize Microsoft Office Bug in Just 3 Days
item.description:
APT28's attacks rely on specially crafted Microsoft Rich Text Format (RTF) documents to kick off a multistage infection chain to deliver malicious payloads.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Google Looker Bugs Allow Cross-Tenant RCE, Data Exfil
item.description:
Attackers could even have used one vulnerable Lookout user to gain access to other GCP tenants' environments.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Big Breach or Smooth Sailing? Mexican Gov't Faces Leak Allegations
item.description:
A hacktivist group claims a 2.3-terabyte data breach exposes the information of 36 million Mexicans, but no sensitive accounts are at risk, says government.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Attackers Use Windows Screensavers to Drop Malware, RMM Tools
item.description:
By tapping the unusual .scr file type, attackers leverage "executables that don't always receive executable-level controls," one researcher noted.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: CISA Makes Unpublicized Ransomware Updates to KEV Catalog
item.description:
A third of the "flipped" CVEs affected network edge devices, leading one researcher to conclude, "Ransomware operators are building playbooks around your perimeter."
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Ransomware Gang Goes Full 'Godfather' With Cartel
item.description:
DragonForce is taking cues from organized crime, emphasizing cooperation and coordination among ransomware gangs.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Cyber Success Trifecta: Education, Certifications & Experience
item.description:
Col. Georgeo Xavier Pulikkathara, CISO at iMerit, discusses the importance of fundamentals, continuous learning, and human ingenuity in the face of AI-driven cybersecurity evolution.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Agentic AI Site 'Moltbook' Is Riddled With Security Risks
item.description:
Someone used AI to build an entire Web platform, which then did something predictable and preventable: It exposed all its data through a publicly accessible API.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Cyberspy Group Hacked Governments and Critical Infrastructure in 37 Countries

item.title: VS Code Configs Expose GitHub Codespaces to Attacks
item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Researchers uncover vast cyberespionage operation targeting dozens of governments worldwide
item.description:
Unit 42 tracked the compromise of at least 70 institutions across the 37 countries â€” with the hackers maintaining access to some victims for months. In one country, the hackers gained access to the parliament and a senior elected official.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Substack warns customers of data breach following hackerâ€™s dark web claims
item.description:
Customers of the newsletter platform Substack were notified on Wednesday of a breach, following a hacker's claims on the dark web of a trove of stolen data.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Russian hackers attacking European maritime and transport orgs using Microsoft Office exploit
item.description:
Russian state-linked hackers are exploiting a Microsoft Office vulnerability to target maritime organizations across Europe as part of a â€œsophisticated espionage campaign," researchers said.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: CISA warns of five-year-old GitLab flaw exploited in attacks
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) ordered government agencies to patch their systems against a five-year-old GitLab vulnerability that is actively being exploited in attacks. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: CISA: VMware ESXi flaw now exploited in ransomware attacks
item.description:
CISA confirmed on Wednesday that ransomware gangs have begun exploiting a high-severity VMware ESXi sandbox escape vulnerability that was used in zero-day attacksÂ since at least February 2024. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Hackers compromise NGINX servers to redirect user traffic
item.description:

item.title: RINA Accountants & Advisors is creating $400K settlement fund to settle lawsuit over 2022 data breach
item.description:
Mark Emem reports: A US accounting firm has agreed to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars to settle a class action lawsuit filed over a data breach. According to the settlement administratorâ€™sÂ portal, RINA Accountants & Advisors will set up a $400,000 settlement fund to compensate victims of the data security incident that occurred nearly four... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Threats: Results of a pilot survey on threats, and a new category on DataBreaches.net
item.description:
So Zack Whittaker (of TechCrunch and this week in security fame) and I were chatting about some of the many threats weâ€™ve had to deal with over the years â€” threats of litigation, criminal charges,Â and threats by criminals all leapt immediately to mind. Maybe one day, someone will create a bingo card for countries... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Under Pressure: Exploring the effect of legal and criminal threats on security researchers and journalists
item.description:
â€œDissent Doe,â€ DataBreaches.net admin@databreaches.net Zack Whittaker, this.weekinsecurity.com this@weekinsecurity.com February 2026. [Download .pdf version] Key takeaways Three-quarters of respondents in a pilot survey of journalists and security researchers reported receiving one or more threats due to their work; one-quarter reported never receiving any threats. Overall, half of the respondents reported receiving at least one legal threat.... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: IA: Dallas County to pay $600,000 to security testers arrested in 2019
item.description:
Phillip Sitter and William Morris report and update on a case in Iowa where security researchers were arrested â€” for doing what they had been hired to do. Add this to any list of legal threats researchers face. Dallas CountyÂ is paying $600,000 to two men who sued after they were arrested in 2019 while testing... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Ransomware attack compromised 377,000 peopleâ€™s Social Security and driverâ€™s license numbers from Texas gas station and convenience store chain
item.description:
Kurt Knutsson recently reported on a ransomware attack in September that affected 377,082 individuals. Gulshan Management Services, Inc. is linked to Gulshan Enterprises, which operates around 150 Handi Plus and Handi Stop gas stations and convenience stores across Texas. Gulshan reported the incident to the Maine Attorney Generalâ€™s Office on January 6 and provided a... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Former Nuance Communications employee facing more charges in 2023 Geisinger data breach case
item.description:
John Beauge reports an update to the previously reported case of a former Nuance Communications employee who compromised the protected health information of more than 1.3 million Geisinger Health patients two days after Nuance had terminated his employment for unrelated reasons. Two counts of false statement have been added to the charge against a California... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Donâ€™t panic: 0aptâ€™s listings and data leaks are fakes â€” Researchers
item.description:
If you noticed a lot of dark web leak site listings by a new group, 0apt, and have been concerned about whether they might be a dangerous and prolific group, the DataBreach[.]com team (no relationship to DataBreaches[.]net) has a reassuring message for you:Â the listings and data leaks are fake and a waste of your... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Two Ivy League universities had donor information breaches. Will donors be notified?
item.description:
Harvard University and the University of Pennsylvania (UPenn) have more in common than just being Ivy League universities. Both suffered data breaches involving donor information, and their stolen data was leaked. Harvard On November 18, Harvard discovered that its Alumni Affairs and Development information had been attacked as a result of a phone-based phishing attack.... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Berlin hospitals threatened by spate of attacks
item.description:
Helen Whittle reports: TheÂ BerlinÂ Hospital Association (BKG) has issued a warning describing a spate of seemingly â€œinexplicable incidentsâ€ at hospitals and healthcare facilities in the capital. These range from drone incursions over hospital grounds and cyberattacks to forced entry and arson. The BKG says that Germanyâ€™s security and intelligence services classifyÂ at least some of these attacks... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: OIG audit of hospitalâ€™s cybersecurity finds vulnerabilities in common web applications
item.description:
Chad van Alstin reports: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Office of the Inspector General (OIG) released a report focused on a â€œlarge Southeastern hospitalâ€ that the agency said had security vulnerabilities that could be vectors for a cyberattack. The unnamed hospital, according to the OIG, would have difficulty detecting a data breach... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach
